skill.name: protocolsio-integration
skill.description: Integration with protocols.io API for managing scientific protocols. This skill should be used when working with protocols.io to search, create, update, or publish protocols; manage protocol steps and materials; handle discussions and comments; organize workspaces; upload and manage files; or integrate protocols.io functionality into workflows. Applicable for protocol discovery, collaborative protocol development, experiment tracking, lab protocol management, and scientific documentation.
skill.summary: Integration with protocols.io API for managing scientific protocols. This skill should be used when ...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown files that describe protocols.io API usage. No executable code, scripts, or network operations are present. The skill provides guidance and example patterns for interacting with the protocols.io platform.

content.value_statement: Scientists spend hours searching for and documenting lab protocols manually. This skill provides complete integration with protocols.io API v3, enabling programmatic access to search, create, manage, and publish scientific protocols with team collaboration features.
actual_capabilities: Search and retrieve scientific protocols by keywords, DOI, or category
Create, update, and publish protocols with full step-by-step management
Manage protocol discussions, comments, and threaded replies
Organize protocols within team workspaces with role-based permissions
Upload and manage files, images, and data attached to protocols
Track experiment records and document protocol executions
limitations: Requires valid protocols.io API access token for all operations
Rate limits apply: 100 requests per minute for standard endpoints
File upload size limits depend on workspace configuration

use_cases.title: Protocol discovery
use_cases.description: Search published protocols by technique or keyword and import them for your experiments

use_cases.title: Team collaboration
use_cases.description: Organize shared protocol repositories with workspace permissions and team feedback

use_cases.title: Experiment documentation
use_cases.description: Track protocol executions and document results for reproducibility and lab notebooks

prompt_templates.title: Find protocol
prompt_templates.prompt: Search protocols.io for [KEYWORD] protocols. Show me the results with titles, DOIs, and descriptions.

prompt_templates.title: Create protocol
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new protocol on protocols.io titled [TITLE] with description [DESCRIPTION] and tags [TAGS].

prompt_templates.title: Add steps
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a step to protocol [ID] with title [STEP_TITLE] and description [STEP_DESCRIPTION].

prompt_templates.title: Export data
prompt_templates.prompt: List all protocols in my workspace [WORKSPACE_ID] and help me export them for backup.

output: 2. CRISPR Knock-in Protocol for HEK293 Cells

best_practices: Store API tokens securely in environment variables, never in code
Implement exponential backoff to handle rate limit errors gracefully
Use workspaces to organize protocols by project or lab section
anti_patterns: Hardcoding access tokens in scripts or sharing them publicly
Ignoring rate limits and causing API access to be blocked
Publishing protocols without reviewing steps and adding safety warnings

faq.question: What authentication methods are supported?
faq.answer: CLIENT_ACCESS_TOKEN for personal content and OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN for multi-user applications. Both use Bearer token format.

faq.question: What are the API rate limits?
faq.answer: Standard endpoints: 100 requests per minute. PDF generation: 5 requests per minute for signed-in users.

faq.question: Can I integrate with my lab management system?
faq.answer: Yes, the API supports workspace organization, file uploads, and experiment records for custom integrations.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this integration?
faq.answer: Protocols.io handles data storage. Use OAuth for user consent and never expose tokens in client-side code.

faq.question: Why am I getting 401 errors?
faq.answer: Check that your access token is valid and included correctly as Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN in all requests.
